event.text: You quickly fire up your engines and make a break for it. However, it seems to be in vain. They catch up to you effortlessly and power up their weapons.
You divert all available power to your engines and flee. You caught them off-guard, but they seem to be gaining on you. Luckily you are able to stay out of range long enough to charge the FTL drive.
You fire up the engines and try to escape. Their slower ship is unable to keep pace; eventually it gives up and returns to the beacon to await an easier target.
The pirates aren't fazed by your threats, and instead power up their weapons as well!
"Ok, ok! We get it, you aren't messing around. Sorry to bother you."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE
textList.text: As you jump into the system a pirate advances on your position. They are refusing all hails. Prepare for a fight.
Soon after arriving in the system you are hailed by a small cruiser. "What good fortune that we happen to run into each other. Nothing personal, but you have some information we need!"
The only other ship at this beacon messages you: "Finally, after months of waiting, someone has fallen into our trap!"
You barely have time to register jump completion before your ship warns you of an incoming ship with weapons hot.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MERCENARY
textList.text: You spot a small black market at this beacon, but as you approach it a mercenary ship swings around and attacks. "Hah! What luck of ours. Our clients came here to hire us to scout you out, and here you are in the very same sector!"
"Wouldn't you know it, it's the captain of the hour! I assure you, it's nothing personal. Just, we've been given quite a sum in return for your head. You're a Renegade, so I'm sure you understand."
Seems someone's put a price on your head, because a mercenary is trailing you, weapons online! No surprise, but seems you'll have to take care of this first.

Strangely, Renegades and Mercenaries rarely get along. To the mercs, Renegades lack the honor and distinction the Syndicate brings them. The nearby ship seems to have taken that difference personally and lunges towards you!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_SMUGGLER
textList.text: "I spy with my little eye a ship with some fine gear I'm sure will sell for a pretty penny on the market! Surrender yourselves or suffer the wrath of my cannons!"

Smugglers rarely show aggression for fear of losing their precious cargo. Yet - when their stock is dry, sometimes the odd captain will try their luck and seize the cargo of a passing ship. Seems a bit risky to pick on a ship like yours, but that's their mistake.

"How quaint. I just sold off all my stock and here I was thinking I'd have to make my trek back to Argeonn when you showed up! Thank you kindly for the generous donation, stranger!" You aren't sure what the smugglers are referring to until weapons pop out of their hull!
A smuggler approaches, clearly intending to steal rather than to sell. Prepare for combat!

event.name: SLAVER_OFFERS
event.text: The slaver welcomes you aboard and shows you their "wares".
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
You're not interested in their line of trade.

textList.name: TEXT_SLAVER_FRIENDLY
textList.text: You recognize the nearby ship as a well-known Tiiikaka slave trader. He hails you and offers you "laborers" for cheap.
A shifty looking slaver approaches, hailing with offers of promising and willing workers for a reasonable price.
"My friend, my friend, I empathize with what surely must be a great labor shortage aboard your vessel. Renegades don't have a long life expectancy, after all. Perhaps I can offer a solution?"
"Feeling frisky, friend? I can offer you something to help keep you warm at night, heheh... Not your thing? Well, I'm sure my 'wares' might have other uses aboard your vessel."
An unwashed slaver appears on your screen, promoting the fact his workers will do anything you tell them, satisfaction guaranteed or your money back.
It's sometimes appalling how freely slavers move about peddling their cargo. As a rather risky move, a slaver seems to have picked you out as a potential client.

event.text: Slavers are the scum of the galaxy. You'll be doing great justice by wiping this one out.

choice.text: (Upg. Teleporter) Use your teleporter to attempt to board the ship and release some of the slaves.
Ignore the slaver and continue on your way.

event.text: You're not interested in slavers.

You beam a small team into their holds. They work quickly to free the slaves and teleport back to your ship. One of the captives seems fit for battle and you throw them a weapon in preparation for a fight.

You teleport an away team into their hold to attempt to free their prisoners. They are able to get to one person before being caught and forced into a corner by the crew. You quickly beam the team and prisoner back to your ship.

You beam a team onto their ship. However, your estimations of the location of their prisoners was off. By the time they get their bearings the slavers spot them. You beam them back to the ship and prepare for a fight.

textList.name: TEXT_SLAVER_CHOICE
textList.text: An especially aggressive slaver ship approaches you. "Hand over one of your crew-members and the rest of you can go free unharmed. We promise not to hurt them too much."

choice.text: Draw straws and send a crew-member over to the slavers.

event.text: The chosen crew-member leaves without complaint, knowing you had no choice.

removeCrew.text: You briefly consider cloning a replacement, but decide to respect the Federation laws regarding simultaneous duplicates.

choice.text: "Logic error: request cannot be met. This is an automated vessel. Demand: refused."

event.text: How stupid do these guys have to be to demand crew from an automated vessel? You'll have time to think about it after you'll do the world a favor by ridding it of these clowns.

choice.text: We will never surrender one of our crew to slavers!

event.text: You prepare to fight the slaver.

choice.text: (Spider Crew) "Give" them your spider and let them cause havoc.

event.text: "Wait, what is thi- OH GOD AHGHWHAHAGGHHAHHH" The slaver falls to the floor as the spider tears out his throat, and moves on to consume the rest of the crew. While it might have killed everyone aboard, including the slaves, the hull of the ship remains intact for you to scrap.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Attempt to out-run the pirates.

event.name: MERCENARY_OFFERS
event.text: The mercenary grins and names off the various services he can offer.

choice.text: [Reputation: 1+] "You're such a good customer, all services are cheaper!"
Hire the mercenary to delay the Rebels.

event.text: Once the mercenary finishes counting the scrap, they nod in approval. "You're the boss! I'll get right on it..."

choice.text: Hire the mercenary to scout the sector.

event.text: Once the mercenary finishes counting the scrap, they nod in approval. "You're the boss! I'll get right on it..."

choice.text: Hire the mercenary to delay the Rebels.

event.text: Once the mercenary finishes counting the scrap, they nod in approval. "You're the boss! I'll get right on it..."

choice.text: Hire the mercenary to scout the sector.

event.text: Once the mercenary finishes counting the scrap, they nod in approval. "You're the boss! I'll get right on it..."

choice.text: [Reputation: 3+] Hire the mercenary to both scout and delay the fleet.

event.text: Once the mercenary finishes counting the scrap, they nod in approval. "You're the boss! I'll get right on it..."
You're not interested in their line of trade.

textList.name: TEXT_MERCENARY_FRIENDLY
textList.text: The Syndicate has no shortage of guns for hire who'll do just about anything for the right price. The vessel here is no exception.

A ship hails you: "Greetings! It seems you're having some difficulty with the Rebellion. I'd love to help, but I can't afford the upkeep required on this hunk of junk I'm flying... maybe we can come to an arrangement?"
"Got scrap? Need something done? Well, I'm the man for you!" The mercenary at this beacon flashes a toothy grin to reassure you.

Thanks to Vael and the Syndicate, mercenaries are swarming the galaxy. Their less-than-legal services are in high demand, and one is waiting nearby for ships like you that might find some use in their services.
A ship with Syndicate markings orbits a nearby backwater station. You receive a shady message: "Anything is possible, for the right price."
"I've caught word... a Renegade? You must be busy. Busy busy, indeed! I understand your mission is quite important. Maybe, for a litle payment, I can make life easier for you?"

event.text: Mercenaries are hardly any better than Rebels, just troublemakers with shifting allegiances. Time to cut the Syndicate's ranks short another member.

choice.text: Ignore the mercenary and continue on your way.

event.text: You're not interested in mercenaries.

textList.name: TEXT_MERCENARY_CHOICE
textList.text: Upon completing your jump, you receive a message from a nearby mercenary. "Greetings and welcome to our beacon! For a small fee, we'll let you continue on your way."

"Well well well, if it isn't just the ship of the hour! I just had a client come by and pay me a handsome sum to kill you. Though... I'll make you a unique deal. Pay me the same rate, and I'll let you go."
"Ah, hello my friends! It is most unfortunate, for you, that we meet here in such a way! My clients just left, and they've given me quite the sum of money. Perhaps you could... match their pricing?"

"Today is a wonderful day, Captain! I have been paid a bountiful amount of scrap with the task of killing you! I'm afraid I will have to follow through with this... unless you could... give us some more scrap?"

event.text: "You made the right decision, friend."
"Too bad... You will regret this decision!"

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Attempt to out-run the pirates.

event.name: SMUGGLER_OFFERS
event.text: The smuggler pats you on the back and welcomes you into their cargohold.
"Many thanks for taking this off my hands! Just a word of advice... try not to let the authorities see you with it for another couple jumps."
"Many thanks for taking this off my hands! Just a word of advice... try not to let the authorities see you with it for another couple jumps."
"Many thanks for taking this off my hands! Just a word of advice... try not to let the authorities see you with it for another couple jumps."
You're not interested in their line of trade.

textList.name: TEXT_SMUGGLER_FRIENDLY
textList.text: An Argeonn smuggler spins you a tale of the dangers of the open galaxy before pushing his wares. You doubt any of his contraband is exactly legal, but maybe it's worth a look?
You've heard stories, both good and bad, of Argeonn and their solicitations. A cocky and haphazardly shaven smuggler extends an offer to sell you some 'premium gear' for what he claims is dirt cheap.
"What great fortune it is that we've met each other on this occasion. You have scrap, and I have equipment. Perhaps we can arrange a deal?"
"There's no limit to the treasures my cargo carries, captain. And they can all be yours too! Just, for a price..."
The Federation is fairly lax on Argeonn and its smugglers, as their inter-dimensional services make cheap for transportation. With little to fear, a smuggler nearby peddles you some gear.

"I almost joined the Renegade business once... but it just wasn't the life for me. I much prefer Argeonn, I get the adrenaline rush with far less of the risk. You wouldn't happen to need any gear, would you?"

event.text: Smugglers might usually be known for their military sales, but Argeonn transports plenty else. Who knows what kinds of harmful items have traveled through this ship's cargo into the hands of all kinds of bad actors. The only responsible course of action is to take these guys down.

choice.text: Ignore the smuggler and continue on your way.

event.text: You're not interested in smugglers.

textList.name: TEXT_SMUGGLER_CHOICE
textList.text: A smuggler approaches, brandishing their weapons but not their contraband. "Sorry we meet on unfavorable terms, but we're starved for fuel and I'm afraid you're our only shot to get out of here before the patrols catch us. No hard feelings, it's just business."

event.text: "You made the right decision, friend."
"Too bad... You will regret this decision!"

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Attempt to out-run the pirates.
